page.text: At this point, we have successfully installed PyTgCalls and installed an MTProto client; we are now aiming towards the core of the library. It’s time to start playing with the API!
Making API method calls with PyTgCalls is very simple. Here’s a basic example we are going to examine step by step:
page.syntax-highlight: from pytgcalls import PyTgCalls from pytgcalls import idle ... api_id = 12345 api_hash = '0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef' ... app = PyTgCalls(client) app.start() app.play( -1001185324811, 'http://docs.evostream.com/sample_content/assets/sintel1m720p.mp4', ) idle()

list.item:
Let’s begin by importing the Client class and idle function:
from pytgcalls import PyTgCalls from pytgcalls import idle

Now let’s import your MTProto Client:
PyrogramMod Telethon Hydrogram
from pyrogram import Client
from telethon import TelegramClient
from hydrogram import Client

Set your api_id and api_hash taken from my.telegram.org:
api_id = 12345 api_hash = '0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef'

Initialize the MTProto client:
PyrogramMod Telethon Hydrogram
client = Client('test_session', api_id, api_hash)
client = TelegramClient('test_session', api_id, api_hash)
client = Client('test_session', api_id, api_hash)

Initialize the PyTgCalls client:
app = PyTgCalls(client)

Now you can call any method you want:
app.play( -1001185324811, 'http://docs.evostream.com/sample_content/assets/sintel1m720p.mp4', )

Lastly, call the idle function to keep your code running:
idle()

page.text: In case you wish to run PyTgCalls asynchronously:

list.item:
Import PyTgCalls, AsyncIO and create an instance:
import asyncio from pytgcalls import PyTgCalls from pytgcalls import idle ... app = PyTgCalls(client)

Async methods can’t be executed at the top level, because they must be within an async-defined function; here, we define one, and we put our code inside it; method calls require the await keyword:
async def main(): await app.start() await app.play( -1001185324811, MediaStream( 'http://docs.evostream.com/sample_content/assets/sintel1m720p.mp4', ) ) await idle()
Then, we tell asyncio to call main() in async mode asyncio.run(main())
